Canada, We're Into You | Bon Appétit




 
 




































      Presented By    






















   
  Our neighbor to the north is not messing around when it comes to eating and drinking. From world-class coffee in Vancouver to insanely fresh oysters from Prince Edward Island, butternut squash bannock pizza in Winnipeg to foraged mushrooms in Ontario, the issue isn’t how to find good food but rather how to winnow down a reasonable eating itinerary. So let’s get started.    







                                                                                                         
 
 










Beauty and Brine: Prince Edward Island Is an Oyster-Lover’s Paradise


The tiny province delivers big on bivalves.
by CHANTAL MARTINEAU














Where the Waves Are Fast and the Food Is Slow


In Nova Scotia surf‑and‑turf isn’t just a main course, it’s a way of life, a way to play and a reason to stay.
by MELISSA BUOTE













I’d Never Even Heard of Bite House, Now I’ll Never Forget It


Sixteen seats, 9 courses, and 1 electric stove: a look at one of North America’s most beautiful and unlikely restaurants.
by ALEX DELANY














I Go to Montreal for Haitian Patties, Not Poutine


From crispy pieces of delicious fried pork to piquant and flaky patties, here’s all the Haitian food you need to eat in the City of Saints.
by TERENCE TROUILLOT













The Restaurant at Pearl Morissette Offers a Tasting Menu for the Climate-Conscious Era


Regenerative agriculture inspires exhaustive experiments in local flavor at Jordan Station’s fine‑dining gem.
by ALIZA ABARBANEL













There Will Be Cake: A Very Detailed Guide to Road-Tripping the Canadian Rockies


From high‑altitude sourdough to remote lakeside teahouses, this Canadian road trip is the flannel‑wearing adventure of a lifetime.
by LINDSAY ANDERSON














I Live in Brooklyn But My Favorite Place to Drink Coffee is 3,000 Miles Away in Vancouver


I visited 12 cafés in 48 hours to find the most beautiful cafés, nuanced coffee, and flakiest pastries the city has to offer.
by CHRIS MOROCCO













The 8 Cantonese Restaurants That Make Me Want to Move to Canada


If you had the dim sum in Richmond, you’d understand.
by ELYSE INAMINE













If You Like Wine and Beautiful Views, You Should Probably Go to the Okanagan Valley


With 185 wineries and a crystal clear lake smack dab in the middle of the place, it’s easy to see why the Okanagan is a destination worth seeking out.
by EMILY SCHULTZ














Serving Up Resilience: Indigenous Chefs Preserve Native Foodways—and Create New Ones


Chefs from across Turtle Island are reclaiming their roots and sharing their take on traditional foods.
by REBECCA THOMAS
author: Condé Nast
